01-01.title: First Transatlantic Television Broadcast
01-01.description: On January 1, 1962, the first transatlantic television broadcast via satellite was successfully completed between the United States and Europe using the Telstar satellite.

01-01.title: Euro Currency Introduced
01-01.description: On January 1, 1999, the Euro currency was introduced electronically, representing one of the largest technological implementations of a unified currency system across multiple nations.

01-03.title: First Apple Computer Announced
01-03.description: On January 3, 1977, Apple Computer was incorporated and the Apple I computer was officially announced, marking the beginning of the personal computer revolution.

01-04.title: Utah Teapot Created
01-04.description: On January 4, 1975, Martin Newell created the Utah Teapot, a 3D test model that became one of the most famous objects in computer graphics history and a standard reference object.

01-09.title: Apple Macintosh Unveiled
01-09.description: On January 9, 1984, Apple Computer unveiled the Macintosh, the first commercially successful personal computer to feature a mouse and graphical user interface.

01-10.title: First Successful Demonstration of ARPANET
01-10.description: On January 10, 1969, researchers successfully demonstrated ARPANET, the precursor to the modern Internet, by connecting computers at UCLA and Stanford.

01-13.title: First Radio Broadcast
01-13.description: On January 13, 1910, the first public radio broadcast was made from the Metropolitan Opera House in New York City, featuring Enrico Caruso and other opera stars.

01-15.title: Wikipedia Launched
01-15.description: On January 15, 2001, Wikipedia was launched by Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger, creating the world's largest collaborative online encyclopedia.

01-19.title: First Electric Lighting Installation
01-19.description: On January 19, 1883, the first standardized electric lighting system using incandescent bulbs was installed in a commercial building at Holborn Viaduct in London.

01-24.title: First Apple Macintosh Goes on Sale
01-24.description: On January 24, 1984, the Apple Macintosh personal computer went on sale, revolutionizing personal computing with its graphical user interface and mouse.

01-24.title: IBM's Deep Blue Debut
01-24.description: On January 24, 1996, IBM's Deep Blue chess computer played its first game against world champion Garry Kasparov, marking a milestone in artificial intelligence.

01-27.title: First Telephone Exchange Opened
01-27.description: On January 27, 1878, the first commercial telephone exchange began operation in New Haven, Connecticut, with 21 subscribers.

01-28.title: Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster
01-28.description: On January 28, 1986, the Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds after launch, leading to major technological and safety reforms in the space program.

01-30.title: First Successful Television Broadcast
01-30.description: On January 30, 1926, John Logie Baird gave the first public demonstration of true television to members of the Royal Institution in London.

02-01.title: Space Shuttle Columbia Disaster
02-01.description: On February 1, 2003, the Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated during re-entry, leading to technological improvements in spacecraft safety and thermal protection systems.

02-01.title: First Weather Satellite Launched
02-01.description: On February 1, 1958, Explorer 1, the first U.S. satellite, was launched, discovering the Van Allen radiation belts and pioneering space-based Earth observation.

02-03.title: First Soft Moon Landing
02-03.description: On February 3, 1966, the Soviet Luna 9 spacecraft made the first soft landing on the Moon and transmitted the first photographs from the lunar surface.

02-04.title: Facebook Launched
02-04.description: On February 4, 2004, Facebook was launched from Mark Zuckerberg's Harvard dorm room, eventually becoming one of the largest social media platforms in history.

02-04.title: Yahoo! Founded
02-04.description: On February 4, 1994, Yahoo! was founded by Jerry Yang and David Filo, becoming one of the first major internet directories and search engines.

02-05.title: Colossus Computer Activated
02-05.description: On February 5, 1944, the British codebreaking center at Bletchley Park activated Colossus, one of the world's first electronic digital computers, to help decrypt German wartime communications.

02-05.title: Bakelite, the First Synthetic Plastic, Announced
02-05.description: On February 5, 1907, Belgian chemist Leo Baekeland publicly announced Bakelite, the first fully synthetic plastic, which became a foundation for the modern plastics industry.

02-05.title: Greenwich Time Signal Begins Broadcasting
02-05.description: On February 5, 1924, the Royal Greenwich Observatory and the BBC began broadcasting the Greenwich Time Signal, the series of radio 'pips' used to mark the exact start of each hour.

02-09.title: Oldest Known Star in the Milky Way Measured
02-09.description: On February 9, 2014, astronomers from the Australian National University announced observations of one of the oldest known stars in the Milky Way, believed to have formed shortly after the Big Bang and providing clues about the first generation of stars.

02-11.title: Thomas Edison's Birth
02-11.description: On February 11, 1847, Thomas Edison was born. He would go on to hold 1,093 patents and invent the phonograph, practical electric light bulb, and motion picture camera.

02-14.title: ENIAC Computer Unveiled
02-14.description: On February 14, 1946, the ENIAC (Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer), the first general-purpose electronic digital computer, was unveiled at the University of Pennsylvania.

02-15.title: First Computer Chess Program to Beat a Human
02-15.description: On February 15, 1996, IBM's Deep Blue chess computer defeated world champion Garry Kasparov in one game of a six-game match, the first time a computer beat a reigning world champion under tournament conditions.

02-17.title: First Digital Computer Patent Filed
02-17.description: On February 17, 1942, John Atanasoff and Clifford Berry filed a patent for the Atanasoff-Berry Computer (ABC), recognized as the first electronic digital computer.

02-20.title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
02-20.description: On February 20, 1962, John Glenn became the first American to orbit the Earth aboard Friendship 7, demonstrating the reliability of spacecraft technology.

02-20.title: First Liquid-Fueled Rocket Launch
02-20.description: On February 20, 1929, Robert H. Goddard launched the first rocket with scientific instruments, advancing liquid-fueled rocket technology.

02-23.title: First Cloning of an Adult Mammal Announced
02-23.description: On February 23, 1997, scientists announced the cloning of Dolly the sheep, the first mammal cloned from an adult somatic cell, representing a major breakthrough in biotechnology.

02-24.title: Hubble Space Telescope Launched
02-24.description: On February 24, 1990, the Space Shuttle Discovery launched the Hubble Space Telescope, which would revolutionize astronomy despite initial optical problems that were later fixed by a servicing mission.

02-26.title: First Grand Central Terminal Opens
02-26.description: On February 26, 1913, Grand Central Terminal opened in New York City, featuring revolutionary engineering including the world's largest train shed and advanced electric train technology.

02-28.title: DNA Structure Discovered
02-28.description: On February 28, 1953, James Watson and Francis Crick discovered the double-helix structure of DNA, laying the foundation for modern genetics and biotechnology.

02-28.title: First Color Television Broadcast
02-28.description: On February 28, 1954, the first color television broadcast using the NTSC standard was transmitted in the United States, advancing broadcast technology.

03-03.title: First Successful Heart-Lung Transplant
03-03.description: On March 3, 1981, the first successful heart-lung transplant was performed at Stanford University Hospital, advancing medical technology and surgical techniques.

03-03.title: Bell Telephone Company Founded
03-03.description: On March 3, 1875, Alexander Graham Bell and his partners founded the Bell Telephone Company, which would become AT&T and dominate telecommunications for a century.

03-07.title: Alexander Graham Bell Patents Telephone
03-07.description: On March 7, 1876, Alexander Graham Bell received patent number 174,465 for 'improvements in telegraphy' - the telephone, revolutionizing communication technology.

03-10.title: First Telephone Call
03-10.description: On March 10, 1876, Alexander Graham Bell made the first successful telephone call, saying 'Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you' to his assistant in the next room.

03-12.title: First Email Sent
03-12.description: On March 12, 1972, Ray Tomlinson sent the first email, using the '@' symbol to separate user names from machine names, creating the foundation for modern digital communication.

03-12.title: World Wide Web Announced
03-12.description: On March 12, 1989, Tim Berners-Lee submitted a proposal for what would become the World Wide Web at CERN, revolutionizing information sharing globally.

03-14.title: Albert Einstein's Birthday
03-14.description: On March 14, 1879, Albert Einstein was born. His theories of relativity would fundamentally change our understanding of physics and lead to technologies like GPS.

03-16.title: First Liquid-Fueled Rocket Launch
03-16.description: On March 16, 1926, Robert H. Goddard launched the world's first liquid-fueled rocket in Auburn, Massachusetts, laying the foundation for modern rocketry and space exploration.

03-17.title: First Color Television Broadcast
03-17.description: On March 17, 1954, the first color television broadcast using the NTSC standard was transmitted, advancing broadcast technology and color science.

03-20.title: First GPS Satellite Launched
03-20.description: On March 20, 1978, the first GPS (Global Positioning System) satellite was launched, beginning a navigation revolution that would transform transportation, mapping, and location-based services.

03-23.title: World Meteorological Day
03-23.description: March 23 is World Meteorological Day, commemorating the establishment of the World Meteorological Organization in 1950 and promoting weather technology and climate science.

03-24.title: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill
03-24.description: On March 24, 1989, the Exxon Valdez oil tanker ran aground in Alaska's Prince William Sound, leading to advances in oil spill cleanup technology and environmental monitoring.

03-26.title: First Successful Vaccine for Polio Announced
03-26.description: On March 26, 1953, Dr. Jonas Salk announced the successful testing of his polio vaccine, a major breakthrough in medical technology that would nearly eradicate the disease.

03-28.title: Three Mile Island Nuclear Accident
03-28.description: On March 28, 1979, a partial nuclear meltdown occurred at the Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station in Pennsylvania, leading to major reforms in nuclear safety technology and regulation.

03-29.title: First Polar Orbiting Weather Satellite
03-29.description: On March 29, 1960, TIROS-1, the first successful weather satellite, was launched, revolutionizing weather forecasting technology and Earth observation.

03-31.title: Eiffel Tower Opens
03-31.description: On March 31, 1889, the Eiffel Tower opened to the public, representing a major achievement in structural engineering and iron construction technology.

03-31.title: First Webcam Created
03-31.description: On March 31, 1993, the first webcam was created at Cambridge University to monitor a coffee pot, pioneering live video streaming technology.
